Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Tourniquet and Adductor Canal Block on Quadriceps Strength Post-TKA

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, primary elective TKA patients were randomly assigned to one of four groups

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to one of four groups: tourniquet/ACB, tourniquet/no ACB, ACB/no tourniquet, and no tourniquet/no ACB

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of tourniquet and/or adductor canal block (ACB) on postoperative quadriceps strength.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in quadriceps strength, standardized to the contralateral leg.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using [Randomisation Method] with allocation concealment via [Concealment Method].

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 203 patients were randomised: 68 to tourniquet/ACB, 45 to tourniquet/no ACB, 45 to ACB/no tourniquet, and 45 to no tourniquet/no ACB.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in strength measures, pain, or knee buckling across groups.
